reviews.review: Muito bom, quebra um pouco a cabeça.
Um jogo q fica mais divertido com seus amigos para perceber q vc não é o único burro
Melhor jogo de puzzle da história namoral. Muito inovador nos sistemas, ambientação ótima, mistérios que circundam o ambiente que te mantém imerso na história, os personagens são carismáticos, etc.

Um Game de Puzzles relativamente simples, mas com o passar do tempo vai ficando mais complexo afim de explodir seus neuronios ( Talvez eu tenha exagerado um pouco, rs ) e uma história bem divertida [spoiler] um tanto obscura como na maioria dos jogos da Valve hehe [/spoiler]
JOGAÇO 10/10
RECOMENDO!

I personally love this game. 
When I downloaded this game in 2016ish I downloaded it because I heard you can play it offline, and because it was a great game.
Not only have I beaten this game, I have beated it about 10 times before I can say I was satisfied with how fast or how slow I beat the game. 
I recommend this game to people who want a challenge and that can't get online as often as other people.
крута крутая

Portal was one of the greatest first person puzzle games ever created, and Portal 2 does not fall short of expectations. The quirky humor and atmosphere of decay and dystopia that made the original so great has been played as a strength once again, and all other features from voicing, level design, story, replayability, easter eggs, and challenge to the mechanics themselves have all been enhanced. It's pretty near impossible to play Portal 2 and not enjoy it. It ticks all of the boxes that most people are looking for, even for those who don't normally play puzzle games.
BEST. GAME. EVER.

One of the best games I've had the honor of playing. The environment feels real and alive, like I'm actually being sent back in time into this huge facility with hundreds upon thousands of test chambers, not to mention the incredible and time-weathered "destroyed" levels at the beginning that feel real.
Just a nice game, nice story and multiplayer. Great game 10/10

A great puzzle game.

Generally it is a very classic and well-designed puzzle game.
There are some points that made me not very comfortable with it: I gotta say that those turret-cube hybrids are one of the most unsettling creatures I ever seen in video games (well I don't play horror games so might be some exaggeration here). Also some bottomless pit/sewage pool scenes triggered my acrophobia. So basically, I kept that deadpan face (seriously I'm playing alone so no point making a fuss) while hopping between portals but was actually screaming inside :<
To me Portal gives more sense of integrity, while Portal 2 leaves too many questions unsolved as it expands the world setting. The story seems a bit repetitive and has a weird ending just as Portal. 
Despite these drawbacks (actually they're not that seriously disturbing), the music, the environment, the test design and the new cooperation mode are all excellent, so I'd still recommend it to friends. Just remind them to finish Portal before starting Portal 2 :P
Though it seems there isn't possibly a sequel to Portal 2 (at least not another puzzle-solving game featuring Chell) because of the ending, I'd still be rather glad to see a new work in the Portal series. So, the ever-lasting question in the Steam community: when would Gaben learn to count to 3?
